Class ImageProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • Logic.ImageProcess

  • public class ImageProcess
extends java.lang.Object
    Class ImageProcess Works as a Tool class to process graphics

    contains tools methods as static methods

    Since:
    05/02/2020
    Author:
    Weizhi

      • resize

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage resize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                  int newW,
                                                  int newH)
        Resize the img to new width newW and new height newH
        Parameters:
        img - the input image to resize
        newH - new height of the image
        newW - new width of the image
        Returns:
        BufferedImage the resized image

      • outputImage

        public static void outputImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Out put the image as test.png
        Parameters:
        image - the input image to store as file

      • mergeImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage mergeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img1,
                                                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage img2,
                                                      boolean isHorizontal)
        Merge two images into a single image

        The width of the image should be the same while isHorizontal is true

        The height of the image should be the same while isHorizontal is false

        Parameters:
        img1 - the first input image
        img2 - the second input image
        isHorizontal - set the method to merge, true is up and down, false is left and right
        Returns:
        BufferedImage the merged image

      • addImageByIcon

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage addImageByIcon(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffImg,
                                                          java.lang.String iconPath,
                                                          int x,
                                                          int y)
        Fold two images into a single image
        Parameters:
        buffImg - the input image
        iconPath - the file path of the image which is going to place at the input image
        x - the position x of the icon on input image
        y - the position y of the icon on input image
        Returns:
        BufferedImage the folded image

                                                           InstantInfo instantInfo)
        get the BufferedImage mini map
        Parameters:

        instantInfo - the entities rendering info
        Returns:
